trans-unit.source: Prod. Order Planning Setup

The settings in the Prod. Order Planning Setup page control the features of the GX Prod. Order Planning View page, which shows the operations of production orders in combination with their work centers (or machine centers).

seg-source.mrk: Order Planning Setup page control the features of the GX Prod.
Order Planning View page, which shows the operations of production orders in combination with their work centers (or machine centers).

trans-unit.source: In the navigation pane, click cc|graphical extension > Prod. Order Planning Setup.

seg-source.mrk: In the navigation pane, click cc|graphical extension > Prod.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Planning Setup page, General FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Order Planning Setup page, General FastTab

trans-unit.source: General FastTab

The fields on the General FastTab are the same fields as in the base scheme setup (refer to topic "General FastTab" on page 1). However, any values changed on the Prod. Order Planning Setup page override the settings in the scheme.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the General FastTab are the same fields as in the base scheme setup (refer to topic "General FastTab" on page 1).
However, any values changed on the <span class="Bold">Prod.
Order Planning Setup page override the settings in the scheme.

trans-unit.source: Machine Centers
The fields on the Machine Centers FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Machine Centers FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Planning Setup page, Machine Centers FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Order Planning Setup page, Machine Centers FastTab

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Show Work Center Groups
Enables or disables rendering of work center groups.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables rendering of work center groups.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Group Filter
Controls which work center groups are shown.

seg-source.mrk: Controls which work center groups are shown.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Group Height
Height of work center group rows in the right part of the view. A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

seg-source.mrk: Height of work center group rows in the right part of the view.
A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Group Pattern Code
Pattern that is used to render the caption of work center group rows within the right part of the view.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern that is used to render the caption of work center group rows within the right part of the view.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Filter
Controls which work centers are shown.

seg-source.mrk: Controls which work centers are shown.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Height
Height of work center rows in the right part of the view. A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

seg-source.mrk: Height of work center rows in the right part of the view.
A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

trans-unit.source: Work Center Pattern Code
Pattern that is used to render the caption of work center rows within the right part of the view.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern that is used to render the caption of work center rows within the right part of the view.

trans-unit.source: Machine Center Filter
Controls which machine centers are shown.

seg-source.mrk: Controls which machine centers are shown.

trans-unit.source: Machine Center Pattern Code
Pattern that is used to render the caption of machine center rows within the right part of the view.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern that is used to render the caption of machine center rows within the right part of the view.

trans-unit.source: Machine Center Height
Height of machine center rows in the right part of the view. A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

seg-source.mrk: Height of machine center rows in the right part of the view.
A value of zero forces the GX view to automatically recognize the height.

trans-unit.source: Prod. Orders FastTab
The fields on the Prod. Orders FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: Orders FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Planning Setup page, Prod. Orders FastTab
Field
Description
Show Simulated Prod. Orders
Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Simulated.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Simulated.

trans-unit.source: Sim. Prod. Order Pattern Code
Pattern with which simulated production orders are drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern with which simulated production orders are drawn.

trans-unit.source: Show Planned Prod. Orders
Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Planned.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Planned.

trans-unit.source: Plan. Prod. Order Pattern Code
Pattern with which planned production orders are drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern with which planned production orders are drawn.

trans-unit.source: Show Firm Planned Prod. Orders
Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Firm Planned.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Firm Planned.

trans-unit.source: Firm Plan. Prod. Order Pattern Code
Pattern with which firm planned production orders are drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern with which firm planned production orders are drawn.

trans-unit.source: Show Released Prod. Orders
Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Released.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Released.

trans-unit.source: Rel. Prod. Order Pattern Code
Pattern with which released production orders are drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern with which released production orders are drawn.

trans-unit.source: Show Finished Prod. Orders
Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Finished.

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the rendering of production orders with the status = Finished.

trans-unit.source: Fin. Prod. Order Pattern Code
Pattern with which finished production orders are drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern with which finished production orders are drawn.

trans-unit.source: Show Production Orders

Controls whether production orders are shown. The production orders can be rendered in a special area at the top of the view. You can choose to group them by their status. In this case, a separate row for each enabled status is shown.

seg-source.mrk: Controls whether production orders are shown.
The production orders can be rendered in a special area at the top of the view.
You can choose to group them by their status.
In this case, a separate row for each enabled status is shown.

trans-unit.source: Prod. Order Pattern Code
If Show Production Orders = Show, this pattern is used when rendering the caption part of the row that contains the production order headers.

seg-source.mrk: If Show Production Orders = Show, this pattern is used when rendering the caption part of the row that contains the production order headers.

trans-unit.source: Prod. Order Line View

Controls whether production order lines are shown. The production order lines can be rendered in a special area at the top of the view. You can choose to group them by their status. In this case, a separate row for each enabled status is shown.

seg-source.mrk: Controls whether production order lines are shown.
The production order lines can be rendered in a special area at the top of the view.
You can choose to group them by their status.
In this case, a separate row for each enabled status is shown.

trans-unit.source: Prod. Order Line Pattern Code
If Prod. Order Line View = Show, this pattern is used when rendering the caption part of the row that contains the production order lines.

seg-source.mrk: Order Line View = Show, this pattern is used when rendering the caption part of the row that contains the production order lines.

trans-unit.source: Routing Lines FastTab
The fields on the Routing Lines FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Routing Lines FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Planning Setup page, Routing Lines FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Order Planning Setup page, Routing Lines FastTab

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Show Routing Lines

Enables or disables the drawing of the routing lines. Each production order can contain production order lines. And each production order line can contain multiple production order routing lines (= operations).

seg-source.mrk: Enables or disables the drawing of the routing lines.
Each production order can contain production order lines.
And each production order line can contain multiple production order routing lines (= operations).

trans-unit.source: Planned Rtng Lines Pattern
Each production order routing line has a routing status. You can link each possible routing status to a pattern code, so you can see the status at first sight.

seg-source.mrk: Each production order routing line has a routing status.
You can link each possible routing status to a pattern code, so you can see the status at first sight.

trans-unit.source: This field contains the pattern for routing lines with status = Planned. If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

seg-source.mrk: This field contains the pattern for routing lines with status = Planned.
If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

trans-unit.source: In Progress Rtng Lines Pattern
Contains the pattern for routing lines with status = In progress. If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

seg-source.mrk: Contains the pattern for routing lines with status = In progress.
If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

trans-unit.source: Finished Rtng Lines Pattern
Contains the pattern for routing lines with status = Finished. If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

seg-source.mrk: Contains the pattern for routing lines with status = Finished.
If this field is empty, the pattern code of a routing line is taken from the status of the production order.

trans-unit.source: Hard Linking Dependencies
Routing lines are linked by their “Next Operation” and “Previous Operation” properties. This relation is also displayed in the GX view.

seg-source.mrk: Routing lines are linked by their “Next Operation” and “Previous Operation” properties.
This relation is also displayed in the GX view.

trans-unit.source: If selected, the relation is updated (like a preview) while dragging a job in the GX view. Otherwise, the view is updated after you finished dragging a job.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the relation is updated (like a preview) while dragging a job in the GX view.
Otherwise, the view is updated after you finished dragging a job.

trans-unit.source: Check Item Availability
If selected, an item availability check is performed for each job. If some components are missing at the starting date, a red exclamation mark is drawn within the job to warn the user.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, an item availability check is performed for each job.
If some components are missing at the starting date, a red exclamation mark is drawn within the job to warn the user.

trans-unit.source: Show Progress
Determines whether to show a progress in the routing lines. The progress is rendered in the bottom part of the job if the routing status = In progress. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines whether to show a progress in the routing lines.
The progress is rendered in the bottom part of the job if the routing status = In progress.

trans-unit.source: Disabled – draws no progress bar
e.g.:
Duration – show the posted duration
Duration % – posted duration divided by planned duration

seg-source.mrk: Duration % – posted duration divided by planned duration

trans-unit.source: Quantity % – finished quantity divided by quantity

seg-source.mrk: Quantity % – finished quantity divided by quantity

trans-unit.source: e.g.:
Progress Pattern Code
Pattern for with to render the progress bar. You can set the height of the progress bar in the Job Height field of the pattern.

seg-source.mrk: Pattern for with to render the progress bar.
You can set the height of the progress bar in the Job Height field of the pattern.

trans-unit.source: Runtime Editable
Disables or enables the modification of the runtime.

seg-source.mrk: Disables or enables the modification of the runtime.

trans-unit.source: Capacity FastTab
The fields on the Capacity FastTab are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Capacity FastTab are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: : Prod. Order Planning Setup page, Capacity FastTab

seg-source.mrk: Order Planning Setup page, Capacity FastTab

trans-unit.source: Field
Description
Show Capacities
Disables or enables the capacity rendering. If selected, each row has a special rendering area where a capacity profile is drawn.

seg-source.mrk: Disables or enables the capacity rendering.
If selected, each row has a special rendering area where a capacity profile is drawn.

trans-unit.source: Capacity Render Mode
Indicates how a capacity profile is drawn. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Indicates how a capacity profile is drawn.

trans-unit.source: Normal
Days – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per day with a vertical progress bar.

seg-source.mrk: Days – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per day with a vertical progress bar.

trans-unit.source: Weeks – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per week with a vertical progress bar.

seg-source.mrk: Weeks – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per week with a vertical progress bar.

trans-unit.source: Months – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per month with a vertical progress bar.

seg-source.mrk: Months – Shows the capacity and the capacity load per month with a vertical progress bar.

trans-unit.source: Days Bars, Weeks Bars, Months Bars – Shows the capacity load (left) and capacity (right) per period. The caption of both bars is always in minutes.

seg-source.mrk: Days Bars, Weeks Bars, Months Bars – Shows the capacity load (left) and capacity (right) per period.
The caption of both bars is always in minutes.

trans-unit.source: Capacity Period Offset
If the value in the Capacity Render Mode field is:

seg-source.mrk: If the value in the Capacity Render Mode field is:

trans-unit.source: Other than Normal, this value defines an offset that can be used to modify the starting day the chosen period.

seg-source.mrk: Other than Normal, this value defines an offset that can be used to modify the starting day the chosen period.

trans-unit.source: Weeks – the period starts on a Sunday.

seg-source.mrk: Weeks – the period starts on a Sunday.

trans-unit.source: If you enter a value of one in this field, the week period starts on a Monday.

seg-source.mrk: If you enter a value of one in this field, the week period starts on a Monday.

trans-unit.source: Capacity Caption Mask
If the Capacity Render Mode field = Days, Weeks, or Months, this value is a macro for the caption within the capacity. The following placeholders can be used within the caption:

seg-source.mrk: If the Capacity Render Mode field = Days, Weeks, or Months, this value is a macro for the caption within the capacity.
The following placeholders can be used within the caption:

trans-unit.source: %RATIO – the ratio: capacity load divided by capacity

seg-source.mrk: %RATIO – the ratio: capacity load divided by capacity

trans-unit.source: %L – capacity load
%LM – capacity load in minutes without decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %LM – capacity load in minutes without decimal places

trans-unit.source: %LH – capacity load in hours with two decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %LH – capacity load in hours with two decimal places

trans-unit.source: %LD – capacity load in days with two decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %LD – capacity load in days with two decimal places

trans-unit.source: %P – capacity
%PM – capacity in minutes without decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %PM – capacity in minutes without decimal places

trans-unit.source: %PH – capacity in hours with two decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %PH – capacity in hours with two decimal places

trans-unit.source: %PD – capacity in days with two decimal places

seg-source.mrk: %PD – capacity in days with two decimal places

trans-unit.source: %WEEKDAY – name of the day
%MONTH – name of the month
%DAY, %D – number of the day within the month

seg-source.mrk: %DAY, %D – number of the day within the month

trans-unit.source: %DD – number of the day with two places

seg-source.mrk: %DD – number of the day with two places

trans-unit.source: %YEAR, %YYYY – year with four places
%YY – year with only two places
%CW, %WEEK – calendar week
Sales Order Manuf. Preview FastTab

The field on this FastTab defines the pattern to be used with the Sales Order Manufacturing Preview functionality (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Sales Order Manufacturing.htm#_Ref307222975" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Sales Order Manufacturing Preview in GX" on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: The field on this FastTab defines the pattern to be used with the Sales Order Manufacturing Preview functionality (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Sales Order Manufacturing.htm#_Ref307222975" class="RelLinkPageNumber" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">"Sales Order Manufacturing Preview in GX" on page 1</MadCap:xref>).
